page.title: 08TOURISM IN HIGHER POYNTON
page.content: Lyme Park is owned by the National Trust and is open at all times and in all areas.There are two different types of countryside. Around West Parkgate is mainly woodland containing a variety of wildlife such as rabbits squirrels and birds.A small stream runs alongside a steep path leading to the open grassland.Here it is hilly with lots of open spaces and a strong wind blowing. The walkway is a disused railway line converted by the Borough Council into a 15km walkway from Macclesfield to Marple.Evidence of the old railway line can still be seen such a the platform and bridges.Aswell as a separate track for horseriding there are parking and picnic areas.
